summary: The Quad Economic Security Act directs the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Secretary of Commerce, to establish an Economic Security Working Group within the Quad (the United States, Australia, India, and Japan). This group would focus on securing critical supply chains, safeguarding critical infrastructure, countering economic coercion, and addressing supply chain disruptions. The bill mandates reports to Congress on supply chains, regional partners, and negotiation progress. No new funding is authorized.
